summary: "Communication skills" refer to the essential competencies required for effective interaction in professional environments, particularly within the context of EU employment regulations. These skills encompass verbal, non-verbal, and written communication, facilitating collaboration and understanding among diverse stakeholders. In EU legal frameworks, the emphasis on communication skills is critical for ensuring compliance with directives aimed at enhancing workplace inclusivity and productivity. Furthermore, the development of these skills is often mandated in training programs to align with the EU's objectives of fostering a skilled workforce capable of navigating complex regulatory landscapes. Thus, communication skills are integral to achieving both individual and organizational success in the EU employment sector.
